title: How to Cook Snap Peas

steps.headline: Wash the snap peas in a colander with cold water.
steps.description: Take them out of the sink and place them inside a paper towel. Use a blotting motion to dry them.

steps.headline: Inspect the snap peas.
steps.description: Remove any snap peas that have too many blemishes on them or cut off the blemishes and preserve the remaining snap pea.

steps.headline: Place the snap peas on the cutting board.
steps.description: Chop off the ends of the snap peas on each side.

steps.headline: Fill a 3-quart (2839 ml) pot with water.
steps.description: Place the water on the stove. Adjust the temperature on the stove so it begins to boil. Once you notice steam coming from the pot, place the snap peas inside a netted steamer. Place the netted steamer inside the pot so it is submerged in the boiling water.

steps.headline: Cover the pot with the lid.
steps.description: Leave the snap peas on the stove and inside the pot to allow the hot water to boil and cook the peas.

steps.headline: Wait 5 minutes.
steps.description: Remove the pot from the stove and place it on a cooling rack.

steps.headline: Remove the netted steamer with the peas from inside the pot.
steps.description: Place the snap peas on a dish. Place a spoonful of butter onto the peas. Season the peas with a dash of salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Prepare the snap peas by properly washing them and cleaning them.
steps.description: Place them in a medium sized bowl.

steps.headline: Set a non-stick sauté pan onto the stove.
steps.description: Place a few spoonfuls of butter into the pan. Set the temperature on medium heat.

steps.headline: Allow the pan to heat up.
steps.description: Once the butter begins to sizzle, place the snap peas in the pan.

steps.headline: Add a dash of salt and a dash of pepper to the snap peas as they cook.
steps.description: Move the snap peas around using a non-stick utensil. Cook the peas for 1 to 2 minutes until they are done.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from the stove.
steps.description: Place the pan on a cooling rack or potholder. Remove the peas from the pan and place them onto a plate.
